full_summary:
**VISSC II Bid Evaluation Support - Request for Proposal (RFP)**
-----------

### Project Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) is requesting proposals from qualified Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders to provide bid evaluation services in support of the next Victoria-class submarine In Service Support Contract (VISSC II). The proposed contract will commence on an anticipated start date of November 2022 and will run for a period of four years, followed by one optional year.

### Scope of Work

The bidder will provide a dedicated bid evaluation team consisting of a team leader and a minimum of two to a maximum of five team members. The services will include:

* Bid evaluation and assessment
* Support to the Department for creating an effective and defensible bid evaluation process
* Optional provision of bid evaluation software, to be procured via a subcontract

### Key Requirements

The bidder must have expertise in Human Resource Services, Business Consulting/Change Management, and Project Management Services (GSIN: R019BF). The bidder must also have experience in the provision of bid evaluation services to a government agency.

### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation will be based on the bidder's technical approach, experience, and qualifications.

### Security Requirements

A security clearance is required for this project.

### Notice of Change to Solicitation

This requirement is subject to the quarterly refresh cycles of the Task and Solution Professional Services (TSPS) method of supply.

### Trade Agreements

This requirement is subject to various trade agreements, including:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

### Contact Information

For questions and inquiries, please contact:

* Amy Fisher
* MAT.DMarP3BidReceiving-DOMar3ReceptiondesSoumissions@forces.gc.ca
* 101 Colonel By Dr, Ottawa, ON, K1A 0K2

### Submission Instructions

The bidder must submit their proposal electronically to the Procurement Authority. The RFP documents will be provided directly to the qualified SA Holders who are invited to bid on this requirement. The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
